content.question: A lab cart of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, with a rectangular conducting loop of area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> attached to it, rolls down a ramp onto a horizontal surface of negligible friction and then through an area with uniform magnetic field <math alttext="vector B" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></math>. The cart moves a horizontal distance <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> while in the field, and then it moves out of the field and up another ramp identical to the first. Which of the following modifications would decrease the height that the cart rolls up the second ramp?

choices.label: Increasing the magnetic field strength <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> so that there is a greater change in flux through the loop

Increasing the horizontal distance <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the magnetic field so that there is more time for energy to be transferred out of the cart
Increasing the mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the cart so that there is more inertia in the system

Reversing the direction of the magnetic field <math alttext="vector B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> in order to create a force that opposes the motion of the cart

Orienting the area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the rectangular loop to be perpendicular to the velocity in order to create the maximum force.

content.answer: Increasing the magnetic field strength <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> so that there is a greater change in flux through the loop
